name: Cover Crop Type
description: Common name for categories of cover crops

name: Environmental Tolerances
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Drought
values.description: Ability to tolerate drought relative to other species

values.name: Flood
values.description: Ability to tolerate flood relative to other species

values.name: Heat
values.description: Ability to tolerate heat relative to other species

values.name: Low Fertility
values.description: Ability to tolerate poor fertility in general (an amalgamation of low pH soils and/or below-optimum soil tests for N, P, and/or K, sandy soil)

values.name: Salinity
values.description: Ability to tolerate high salinity relative to other species. Scale 1-5

values.name: Shade
values.description: Ability to tolerate shade relative to other species

name: Seeds
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Seed Price per Pound
values.description: Relative cost of seed per pound. $ is least expensive, $$$ is most expensive

values.name: Frost Seeding
values.description: Cover crop can be seeded when ground is frozen

values.name: Aerial Seeding
values.description: Can aerial seeding methods be used for this crop?

name: Growth
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Duration
values.description: Length of time during which the cover crop's entire lifecycle is completed in the selected zone. Cover crops that have different Durations depending on environment or location are reported in order of increasing longevity in nature

values.name: Active Growth Period
values.description: Season in which plants have active growth

values.name: Growing Window
values.description: Relative length of time that is suitable for growing and terminating a cover crop. For example, cover crops with a very short growing window may be planted and terminated during a very short period (e.g., 6-8 weeks) between cash crops

values.name: Establishes Quickly
values.description:
Speed at which the cover crop establishes once planted.

1 - slow to establish
5 - quick to establish

values.name: Ease of Establishment
values.description:
Degree of difficulty in getting cover crop established.

1 - difficult to establish
5 - very easy to establish

values.name: Winter Survival
values.description: Likelihood of cover crop survival over the winter

values.name: Early Spring Growth
values.description: Speed in the spring at which the cover crop breaks dormancy and grows. No star means that early spring growth is not applicable

name: Roots
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Root Architecture
values.description: Primary root structure: tap or fibrous

values.name: Root Depth
values.description: Depth to which the cover crop roots? Considers the relative ability of the roots to grow deeper than the previous crop (to reach residual nitrogen)

name: Termination Methods
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Tillage at Vegetative
values.description:
Likelihood that tillage (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that disturb the soil, as with disking or rotovating) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage. The expert group premises that all cover crops can be terminated with tillage, but that 1 represents hard to terminate with tillage and requires an aggressive technique, whereas 5 is easy to terminate with tillage and requires the least aggressive technique. The techniques are categorized as follows:

5-light disk
4-heavy disk
3-chisel plow
2-rototill
1-moldboard

values.name: Tillage at Flowering
values.description:
Likelihood that tillage (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that disturb the soil, as with disking or rotovating) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage. The expert group premises that all cover crops can be terminated with tillage, but that 1 represents hard to terminate with tillage and requires an aggressive technique, whereas 5 is easy to terminate with tillage and requires the least aggressive technique. The techniques are categorized as follows:

5-light disk
4-heavy disk
3-chisel plow
2-rototill
1-moldboard

values.name: Freezing at Vegetative
values.description:
Likelihood that freezing weather conditions will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage.

5 - Likely to terminate in mild freez
1 - Requires a very significant freeze to terminat

values.name: Chemical at Vegetative
values.description: Likelihood that herbicide application will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the vegetative stage

values.name: Chemical at Flowering
values.description: Likelihood that herbicide application will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage

values.name: Mow at Flowering
values.description: Likelihood that mowing (i.e. destructive mechanical operations that do not disturb the soil) will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage

values.name: Roller Crimp at Flowering
values.description: Likelihood that roller-crimping will successfully terminate the cover crop while it is in the flowering stage. Termination is most successful at higher crop densities (3+ tons of dry matter per acre). Roller crimping is usually used in tandem with chemical termination outside of organic systems

name: Beneficials
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Supports Mycorrhizae
values.description: Cover crop ability to promote relative activity of mycorrhizal fungi in the rhizosphere

values.name: Pollinator Habitat
values.description: Extent to which the cover crop can serve as habitat for pollinators

values.name: Pollinator Food
values.description: Extent to which the cover crop provides food (i.e. leaves, nectar, pollen) for pollinators

name: Weeds
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Volunteer Establishment
values.description:
Risk of previous cover crop volunteering in current cash crop due to management (i.e. the previous cover crop setting seed that becomes part of the soil weed seedbank). Impact depends on crop rotation (i.e. desirability of self-reseeding)

1=rarely volunteers,
5=frequently volunteers

values.name: Persistence
values.description:
Indicates likelihood that the cover crop seed, once planted, will sit in the soil for an extended time then germinate at an inopportune moment (e.g., during cash crop growth). This is a long-term issue in which the "risk is in the cover crop seed bag"

1= rarely has hard seed,
5=hard seed is a frequent concern

name: Disease & Non Weed Pests
description: This data is based on expert opinion

values.name: Discourages Nematodes
values.description:
Ability of a cover crop to decrease nematode populations (e.g., trap crop).

1=poor choice for discouraging nematodes,
5=excellent choice

values.name: Promotes Nematodes
values.description:
Ability of a cover crop to increase nematode populations.

1=does not support nematode populations,
5=excellent for increasing nematode populations

values.name: Discourages Pest Insects
values.description:
Ability of a cover crop to decrease insect pest populations.

1=poor choice for discouraging insect pests,
5=excellent choice

values.name: Promotes Pest Insects
values.description:
Ability of a cover crop to increase insect pest populations.

1=does not promote insect populations,
5=frequently promotes pest insects

values.name: Suppresses Cash Crop Disease
values.description:
Relative ranking of cover crop impact to suppress disease in the following cash crop.

1 - does not suppress disease in following cash crop.
5 - very likely to suppress disease in following cash crop

values.name: Promotes Cash Crop Disease
values.description:
Relative ranking of cover crop impact to promote disease in the following cash crop.

1 - does not promote disease in following cash crop.
5 - very likely to promote disease in following cash crop
